metadata.Title: CVE-2020-20902 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
A CWE-125: Out-of-bounds read vulnerability exists in long_term_filter function in g729postfilter.c in FFmpeg 4.2.1 during computation of the denominator of pseudo-normalized correlation R'(0), that could result in disclosure of information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-20902` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm1
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm1
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm1
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm1
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm1
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm1
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm1
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm1
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm1
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm1').
vice package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
